definition[0]: if something is prepaid, it is paid for before it is needed or used
definition[1]: prepaid amounts are payments for things that you have not yet received
example[2]: The pay phones are designed for phone cards and generate more than $2 billion in prepaid revenues.
definition[2]: a prepaid loan is repaid to the lender before the normal time
example[3]: The loan for the dam was prepaid after criticisms of the way the project was financed.
definition[3]: a prepaid letter, envelope etc is one where the sender does not have to use a stamp
definition[4]: prepaid insurance contracts are to pay for services that may be needed by the insured person in the future
example[5]: Everyone has legal needs and the latest option is a prepaid package from Midwest Legal Services.
